revised_title: Sodium Channel Content and Action Potential Conduction in Myelin-Deficient Optic Nerve
tldr: The study investigates the relationship between action potential conduction and sodium channel content in the optic nerve of myelin-deficient rats. Results show that action potential propagation in myelin-deficient rats is slower, but still secure, with refractory and frequency-following properties similar to control myelinated axons. The study also finds that sodium channel density per axon is equivalent in both myelin-deficient and control optic nerves.
